items.title: Hastie joins Coalition voices backing Rudd, breaking with Ley
items.summary: Sussan Ley appears increasingly at odds with her party room, following ongoing praise of Australian ambassador Kevin Rudd's performance in Washington.

items.title: 'Healing of history’: King Charles and Pope Leo pray together in 500-year first
items.summary: This was the first joint worship between a British monarch and a Catholic pontiff since Henry VIII’s split from Rome.

items.title: Indonesia vows to stay ‘active’ in global sport despite IOC backlash over Israel ban
items.summary: Indonesia says it won’t be sidelined from world sport after the IOC urged federations to stop hosting events there in response to its ban on Israeli gymnasts.

items.title: COVID vaccines could have a cancer-fighting benefit, researchers say
items.summary: The technology behind COVID-19 vaccines is showing promise in cancer treatment, but some say it's too soon to call it proof.

items.title: 'Employers on notice': Landmark ruling could be turning point in WFH debate
items.summary: Employers must cite "reasonable business grounds" for refusing an employee's work-from-home request. Here's why Westpac failed that test.

items.title: 'Still we have no justice': Kumanjayi White's family grieve amidst inquest delays
items.summary: The Director of Public Prosecutions has not confirmed if charges will be laid against the two officers who restrained Kumanjayi White in Alice Springs.

items.title: This bone could rewrite Australia’s megafauna extinction story
items.summary: Were giant kangaroos hunted to extinction? Some researchers think otherwise.

items.title: Boom towns: Australia's surging suburbs, record prices and Brisbane's rise to No. 2
items.summary: It's been a strong quarter for the housing market, according to a new report. Find out which suburbs saw the biggest gains.

items.title: Chris was using a sunscreen while he recovered from throat cancer. Then it was recalled
items.summary: More than 20 sunscreen products have been taken off Australian shelves. For the most vulnerable, it's prompted "sunscreen anxiety".

items.title: Lidia Thorpe refers NT attorney-general to corruption watchdog over court interference allegations
items.summary: The Independent Senator for Victoria referred NT Attorney-General Marie-Clare Boothby to the NT Independent Commissioner Against Corruption following allegations of government interference in Supreme Court media activities.

items.title: Top UN court says Israel must allow aid into Gaza to meet 'basic needs' of Palestinians
items.summary: The wide-ranging ICJ ruling, quickly rejected by Israel, came as aid groups scrambled to scale up humanitarian assistance into Gaza.

items.title: US sanctions Russian oil companies as Trump says Putin summit 'didn't feel right'
items.summary: Trump expressed frustration with the stalled negotiations, saying his conversations with Putin "don't go anywhere".

items.title: Australia to send ADF liaison officer to join US-led Gaza peace taskforce
items.summary: The US has agreed to provide up to 200 troops to support the Gaza taskforce and stabilise the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

items.title: Two killed in US strike on alleged drug-smuggling boat in the Pacific Ocean
items.summary: The deadly strike is the eighth since September and follows dozens of targeted killings last month.

items.title: Is the gold rush losing its lustre? What to expect as prices plunge
items.summary: After more than a year of rapid growth, gold experienced its biggest single-day fall in over a decade overnight.

items.title: 'We were defeated': Louvre chief blames CCTV gaps for jewellery heist
items.summary: Louvre director Laurence des Cars said she had repeatedly warned that the centuries-old building's security was in a dire state.

items.title: 'They've been great': Trump made a major concession to Australia on defence
items.summary: After previously calling for more investment in defence, it appears Donald Trump has let Australia off the hook.

items.title: Japan's Sanae Takaichi makes history but will it change things for Japanese women?
items.summary: Sanae Takaichi took office on Tuesday as Japan's first female prime minister but on the same day she appointed only two female ministers in a 19-member cabinet.

items.title: 'It's a big job': Ley backtracks on calls for Kevin Rudd to step down as US ambassador
items.summary: Rudd was caught in an awkward exchange with Donald Trump on Tuesday over derogatory comments he wrote in the past about him.

items.title: The cost of living crisis has financially crippled many Australians. But there's an even bigger problem
items.summary: The cost of living crisis continues to affect many Australians. And the impacts are going well beyond people struggling to pay the bills.

items.title: PM's plane makes emergency landing in US after crew member hurt
items.summary: Anthony Albanese was returning from his trip to the US, where he met with US President Donald Trump.

items.title: The $42 billion 'disaster penalty' hitting these Australian homeowners
items.summary: Flood risks have already wiped billions off the value of Australian homes, according to a new report.

items.title: Trump made no mention of them in his ceasefire address. They say violence is ongoing
items.summary: While the world's focus has been on a ceasefire in Gaza, the occupied West Bank remains a flashpoint.

items.title: Meeting with Putin on hold to avoid 'waste of time', Trump says
items.summary: Donald Trump had announced last week he and Vladimir Putin would meet soon in Hungary to try to bring the war in Ukraine to an end.
